The Warrior for Old School Essentials combines the best options for fighting classes from across the OSR and makes them compatible with your OSR games.

boardgame.name: The White Mage: A Magic User Class for Old School Essentials
boardgame.description:

They study the arcane arts high in their lighthouse sanctums to protect mankind from the destructive powers of tyrannical wizards. The White Mage is a magic user class focused on protection, with 7 new spells for your OSE games.

A Fairy Godmother who bestows powerful blessings upon you.

boardgame.name: Waves Stained Crimson
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In desperation the sailors abandoned their oars and snatched up their weapons. It was valiant, but useless. They had time for one flight of arrows before the pirate was upon them.

From a merciless attack in the dead of night, to bloodthirsty duels in the port of Tortage, life is never easy on the ocean waves. In this thrilling campaign, players will raid cities, avenge being enslaved at the hands of a ruthless buccaneer, and write themselves into legend!

When their ship is sacked, and the daughter of a merchant prince is kidnapped, the players are thrust into a world of intrigue, deadly sorcery, and the threat of apocalypse. Coursing across the raging seas of the Hyborian Age, the adventurers confront terrors of the like they’ve never seen before; degenerate cults, murderous cutthroats, and a weaver of the darkest magics, with a plan for the world that must be halted…

Do you have the courage and fortitude to stand against a rising tide of blood and danger?

A thrilling, all-new campaign for Conan: Adventures In An Age Undreamed Of
Five adventures, creating a series of challenges for even the most experienced of players
New islands to explore, new monsters to fight, and new antagonists to defeat
boardgame.rpg: Robert E. Howard's Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of

boardgame.description: It will be the sixth in the Bus Simulator series,

boardgame.name: Dolmen
boardgame.description: Dolmen is a terrifying new action RPG that combines futuristic Sci-Fi and Cosmic Horror elements.

boardgame.name: Nobody Saves the World
boardgame.description: Transform from a featureless nobody into a SLUG, a GHOST and a DRAGON in this new take on Action RPGs from the creators of Guacamelee!

boardgame.name: Chai Garam
boardgame.description:
Can you ensure a garam (hot) cup of chai (tea) is served to your ever-growing customers on a rainy day? Get ready to dive deep into running a chai tapri (tea shop) by ensuring that your customers get their specific chai and snack orders on time. Earn their appreciation for every correct order, but be quick as another player might steal a few of them away. Run the most successful shop, and be the wealthiest player at the end of the game!

Each turn in Chai Garam, players take one mandatory action, either selecting up to three ingredients from the display (tea leaves, additives, water, milk, godown power cards, etc.) or serving their cooked tea to the grid of customers in the central board and collecting money.

Additionally as free actions, players need to cook tea, compete for goals to improve their star ratings, attract customers to their own shops, or play a "Chai Garam" card to take a double action! The game continues until a special "evening" customer triggers the end of play or any player achieves five stars. At that point, whoever has the highest value from money as well as stars wins.

boardgame.name: Bingo Island
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Bingo Island, an island full of fabulous riches. As a family on this small island, you must grow and harvest resources, befriend animals, and search for treasures.

On your turn, spin the wheel, then place a resource on your field. When you complete a row, column, or diagonal, shout "Bingo!", then collect the appropriate tools and make friends with animals. Finally, search the sand for treasures containing gold coins while trying to avoid the crabs.

As soon as an islander collects four treasures, the game ends, then the islander with the most gold coins wins.

boardgame.name: Federation Commander: Scenario Log
boardgame.description:
Scenarios form a great deal of the history of the Star Fleet Universe. These scenarios were originally published in Captain's Log #32 (which saw the introduction of Federation Commander) through Captain's Log #50. Here you will find scenarios written originally for Star Fleet Battles (and adapted for Federation Commander) and those written new for Federation Commander.

While many of the scenarios are written for two players, you will find some written for three, four, or even five players. There are classic duels with some twists, missions, and two Juggernaut scenarios.

You will need Federation Commander ship cards and rules to play these scenarios; however, you can also simply enjoy reading about the various parts of Star Fleet Universe history.

boardgame.name: AgroChemineer
boardgame.description:
AgroChemineer is an industrial resource management game for 2 to 4 Players that features simultaneous gameplay and an innovative new economy mechanic.

Players buy, manage, then sell different resources until the end of the game year (when a player reaches 10 points)

The player with the most points wins.

With more mouths to feed around the globe, the business of getting the most out of crops, Agrochemistry, is a growing field. The materials market changes each season, so a player must wait until the time is right to purchase resources, research the perfect fertilizer blend, mix up the ingredients in reactors, and fill orders while the demand is at it's highest!

boardgame.name: LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga
boardgame.description: The galaxy is yours with LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga! Play through all nine Star Wars saga films in a brand-new LEGO video game unlike any other. Experience fun-filled adventures, whimsical humor, and the freedom to fully immerse yourself in the LEGO Star Wars universe like never before.
boardgame.videogameversion: North American Xbox Series X edition

boardgame.name: Fog of Love: Love on Lockdown
boardgame.description:
Is your relationship too comfortable or are you just unable to anywhere else?

Love on Lockdown is an expansion to the critically acclaimed, Fog of Love board game. Love on Lockdown tells the story of a couple who find themselves locked inside together for months on end with nothing to do. (How did we ever come up with this idea!?)

While on lockdown, you'll have more to manage than most couples - like your boredom and how reckless you're acting about the Threat. Coping with cabin fever will make or break the relationship - if you can even keep it up that long to begin with!

Navigate a branching storyline that switches paths based on your choices.
Choose the fate of your relationship from 8 new destinies
Explore 45 fun, new Scene cards all concerned with life, love, and happiness on the (literal) inside.

boardgame.name: Devil in the Wilderness: A Game of Witchcraft, Puritans, and New England Indians
boardgame.description:
It is 1689 and King Philip's War, between the Northern English colonies and the Native peoples, is over. Atrocities have been committed by both sides. But the fighting isn't done -- five factions still vie for control of New England...

Devil in the Wilderness is a colonial gothic-horror skirmish game for 1-5 players. A typical game plays in 2 hours and needs a 4x4 game surface with village terrain and 10-15 miniatures per side.

The game can be played using the cards and the traditional rule-book, or with an online game app, available through Application of Force, which works on PCs, smart phones, or tablets. (Both games use the same rules, miniatures, terrain, and dice.)

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fireball Island: Race to Adventure
boardgame.description:
Fireball Island is, once again, teeming with adventure, treasure, and - you guessed it - fireballs! Make your way up the mountain to grab Vul-Kar's Heart, then get off the island before the other adventurers can steal it from you. Along the way, you'll cross bridges, collect treasure, cause earthquakes, rain down fire, and more in this classic game remake.

Note: This is a new, smaller, Target-exclusive, streamlined-by-subtraction version of Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar. The island is smaller, the box is smaller, the cards, side-quests, treasures, and others have been eliminated to make the game simpler and skew towards a younger audience.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
Scenarios form a great deal of the history of the Star Fleet Universe. These scenarios (over 50 of them!) were originally published in Communique #1 through Communique #85. Here they are gathered into one spot as you requested.

Earlier scenarios have been updated to the current format. More options have been added to some of the scenarios. Even better, there is an index by empire involved and the number of players.

You will need Federation Commander ship cards and rules to play these scenarios; however, you can also simply enjoy reading about the various parts of Star Fleet Universe history.

boardgame.name: Suspicious Brew
boardgame.description:
Story:
Our reigning emperor is obsessed with two things: war and herbal tea. In times of war, we are largely free. Since our nation is at peace, we are all forced to spend every waking moment serving the Emperor tea. It's worse than death. It's monotonous. So, we've all decided: The Emperor must die.

So...ahem. We challenge you to a duel!

Experience:
Suspicious Brew is a bluffing game where you and your royal court are locked in a tea-time battle of wits, serving up a deserving death to the Emperor as you compete for the title of “tricksiest hero of all.” The game gets really intriguing and silly when you start choosing your secret agendas based on the evolving social dynamics of the court, knowing your friends know that you know they know you know how they play each role, and that they will use that against you, and you know it! When that happens, you feel determined to outwit them, or to just plain old lie your pants off to thwart their efforts!

Interesting elements:
Your Agendas are chosen, not dealt randomly. The role of Emperor has all the authority to make decisions, and the players they rely on have all the first hand information and are the only ones who can influence the outcome of each round. Each Secret Agenda has a vague alignment, but everyone is in it for themselves, so cooperation outside of your "faction" can be valuable. Everyone has the chance to play the Emperor once before the Emperor dies. The emotional stakes are lower than many other bluffing games, because the narrative being played out is absurd, and person who gets screwed over ultimately is not any of the players but the fictional Emperor.

This game is certified non-toxic to friendships.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Arkham Horror: Broken Token Investigator's Journal
boardgame.description:
House up to four extra Player Boards in a thematically engraved Investigator's Journal.

Player Boards here: Arkham Horror: Broken Token Player Board
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Arkham Horror

boardgame.name: Save the Queen!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The queen needs protection, but first, can you avoid being eaten by her?

under a low canopy of trees in a forest, a light-skinned blond female elf wearing a green corset and tan pants, necklace and headband, caresses a pseudodragon on her lap. The pseudodragon is looking back at a small tyrannosaurus that is walking toward them. A tall-eared red squirrel sits in the corner of the shot looking at the camera.

This adventure is written for a party level 8–9, but the number of enemies can be adjusted for a lower level party, as low as level 4–5.

boardgame.name: The Ember Elk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The fire is coming. Will you prevent it in time?

It’s an old forest with majestic trees so thick that the canopy darkens the forest floor, but a looming danger is coming: the Ember Elk! What will happen to the forest when this flaming deer appears? And what about the goblin woman living in the cottage in the woods — can you save her?

This side adventure is designed for four to six characters with an average party level of 4.

boardgame.name: The Inevitable
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A one-shot side-quest for characters level 4-6.

Can Peace Be Maintained Indefinitely?

The town is perfectly peaceful. Perfectly. Everyone gets along. Always. How can that be bad?

The village that makes its subsistence on spiced melon and red rye holds a dark secret, and the shoemaker and his wife will upset the perfect peace.

boardgame.name: Draconic Omnibus: Silver Dragon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Look into the world of the "shield dragon", and discover how it fits into your 5e campaign!

This supplement includes:


Dragon Background Option Charts
Implied Abilities based on their stat blocks
Associated Creatures, including 4 new draconic hybrid creatures with complete stat blocks
Spellcasting
Lair and Hoard Details, including combat strategies based on age
2 New Magic Items
2 New Spells
Ideas for using the dragon in your campaign
Ideas for using the dragon with your character


All creature and character options are available in the D&D Beyond Homebrew section. Just search for author: doulos12.

boardgame.name: Arieni Kettlewhistle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Arieni Kettlewhistle is a fourth level Ranger (Hunter) halfling who happens to have a paralyzed arm, but she has no problem weilding her hand crossbow and short sword in the other hand! She also has Attention Deficit, so she's easily distracted by interesting plants and fungi, but that hyperfixation makes her a fearsome opponent to vegepygmies and other plant creatures!

boardgame.name: Avery Penn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Avery Penn is a 20-year-old female human innkeeper. She has very long, curled, dark hair and brown eyes. She has rugged, dirty, brown skin. She stands 172cm (5'7") tall and has a round build. She has a tattoo of a cobra on her right arm and a colorful tattoo of the word fear translated into draconic on her back. Born without a left hand, she has a wooden prosthetic with a leather strap and cam cleat that allows her to hold things with it. She is friendly and self-confident and enjoys listening to the villagers’ stories, celebrating with them and being a shoulder to cry on.

boardgame.name: Keyrie Hazelgrove
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Keyrie Hazelgrove, from the adventure Accessible Adventure of the Week: Save the Queen!, is a high elf druid with a pseudodragon sidekick. Keyrie also has Sensory Processing Disorder.

boardgame.name: Wynford Teague
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wynford Teague, from the adventure Accessible Adventure of the Week: The Dark Watchman, is a human lighthouse keeper and archer with back and neck stiffness.

boardgame.name: Catastrophe Caravan
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A lonesome caravan looking for an escort through the mountains. Mysterious foes hide in the forest, and all is not what it seems. Will the cat be let out of the bag? A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 7.

This adventure occurs in the Spine of the World, and is based on the Caravanning! hook from the Dungeoncraft program. Only Season 10 Characters may earn rewards from this adventure if following Adventurers League rules.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Character Generation Tables
boardgame.description:
Creating Disabled and Neuroatypical Characters in Dungeons & Dragons

From the introduction:

This book is a tool to include disabled characters in a Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition setting, both Player Characters and Non-Player Characters. It helps the Dungeon Master and players explore the concept of disability in a fantasy setting, raise awareness of disabled people and communities, and normalize interactions with disabled people.

boardgame.name: For the Girls: First Expansion
boardgame.description: Includes: 180 new cards to be added to the main For the Girls game. Contains new game cards from the 5 different colored decks (pink, blue, purple, orange and green).

boardgame.name: 1824: Seahorse organizer
boardgame.description:
A 3D printed tile organizer/tray system for 1824. The 3 trays have magnets embedded in them to keep them together when stacked in the box so they do not slide around and spill tiles. The lid has steel inserts to keep the top tiles in as well.

This is the largest insert yet with the main tray holding 10 tile tall stacks

Trays fit all tiles fully spread out (even the expansion tiles) so you can just pull them out and get to playing. There is 22 tile locations per tray.

An added option for this design is the token and shares trays. Two trays to hold all of your shares, and a third tray just for tokens. All trays come with magnets and steel embedded for stacking and a lid as well. Easily remove the shares in one batch when a company is parred and have the companies left nicely displayed during play. Sized to fit with the tiles trays and fill the length of the box.

The card slots might look tight but they are designed so that the entire stack is easily removed.

Shares trays will not fit sleeved cards.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: 1824: Austrian-Hungarian Railway (Second Edition)

boardgame.name: Goblin Civil War
boardgame.description:
A bit like the Spanish civil war but with goblins!
characterful easy to paint miniatures, plus a easy to pick up unit-based system, filled with lots of hard choices.
plays out in 2-3 hours

Its a classic 28mm scale, platoon VS platoon wargame 30-50 models a side with a emphasis on infantry, you are fighting for control of objectives and victory points.

The setting is inspired by the Spanish civil war but we have played around with the factions slightly and added units for reasons of game balance and flavour that were not in the real SCW.

boardgame.name: Snake: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
Pre-order now on Kickstarter!

Snake - The Board Game is the tabletop version of the 45 years old classic video game Snake. The result is that you get to see a strategic, tactical side of Snake that you never have. In Snake - The Board Game, you need to plan out every move, growing in a way that is going to block your opponent from doing the same.

The basic premise hasn't changed. You are still trying to eat apples (or dots, depending on how far back you go in the game's history) to get longer and longer. Simply by shifting the speed downward, Snake morphs into something that forces you to think ahead and get much more creative.

Curious? Check it out for yourself on our website, and play Snake - The Board Game online against the computer!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Frame 352
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Frame 352 is a solo photo journaling RPG where players collect photographic evidence of a cryptid in their region. Play involves walking (or skateboarding, wheelchairing, bicycling, rollerblading, canoeing, swimming, driving, or moving in a some way), taking photographs, and note taking, in response to the games central mechanic - a coin pull divination system.

Frame 352 is a printable 1 page foldable zine meant to be carried in your pocket with a handful of coins. Each zine includes enough blank space for 1 playthrough of the game.

boardgame.name: The Perfect Gift
boardgame.description:
Have you ever hoped for a voice-activated armadillo launcher? Or perhaps some invisible jelly bean repellent? And should you get your sister that heat-seeking butterfly cleaner she has always wanted? Well, now you can practice finding that special something for your special someone.

The Perfect Gift is a family-friendly party game for 2 to 6 imaginative players.

Each turn, one player is the lucky recipient. They select one card from their hand to represent the theme of the gifts that they wish for. The other players choose two further cards from their own hand to create an anonymous three part description of a gift - perhaps cute 'n cuddly boa constrictor slippers, or an oversized chocolate-coated snapping turtle. The players all discuss and debate the merits of each gift, and then the recipient chooses which one they would most like to receive. Whoever created that gift gets a point, and the next person becomes the recipient. The game ends after a fixed number of rounds and the person with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: The Lighthouse
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Th e first sign of civilization seen by so many early visitors to Ikstvarr was the lighthouse. Not just any lighthouse — for now this coast is blessed with several — but the lighthouse. Built by Baron Vodom before there was even a town on this island, it once guided ships around the storm-wracked southwest corner to safety in the port of Keelhafen. But its history is also steeped in blood. The memories of those who were there have made their way into the realm of nightmares, and from there they return to this Earth in a shape that kills.

Baron Vodom’s lighthouse no longer stands, but the atrocities committed in and around it have given shape to a new lighthouse. Memories of flayed human skin draped across the tower’s walls and severed limbs hanging from its windows provide it shape and structure. Memories of alarms, of screaming human voices, give it voice and it asks why — “why did you bring me to this island, only to suffer?” — as if it expects an answer from humanity. But it does not. It cares not for answers. Its goal is only the suffering that will give it more memories to use as nightmare fuel.

boardgame.name: Void Sharks
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

When the wizards of Ardoussarlis delved into another world made of darkness, they found the void sharks waiting, floating in the air. So they plucked these creatures from their home like poison flowers and made dogs of them — vicious hounds to guard their sanctums and hunt their foes. They were well-suited for assassinations and executions, even though the meat of human flesh means nothing to them. For it is the soul they devour. And what ghost was ever made from a soul devoured? None that ever haunted a wizard, no matter how cruel.

In their natural environment, the void shark has no face on the ropy, crescent-shaped organ above their shoulders, and but the one mouth on their abdomen. This face only appears once it has devoured a soul, resembling that of the recently devoured, but with crimson eyes and pointy fangs. This face allows it to see, smell, and taste this world. This face allows it to hunt all the better.

Now that there are no more wizards to command them, the void sharks still hunt at night, but spend their days lounging in the city. In Ardoussarlian times, their summoners would let them loose without fear, for even though their bodies are unaffected by gravity, the air is still poison to them. A mere few days would destroy them. But no longer. The gates between the worlds have let enough of this one into that sea of darkness the void sharks swim through that they have built up a tolerance. The organs inside their bodies are still vulnerable — and all the more so when exposed — but now their skin protects them.

boardgame.name: Creature Feature Quarterly Vol. 7 (OSE)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

NOT JUST STATBLOCKS!

16 new monsters for your OLD SCHOOL ESSENTIALS game.

+ Extensive Fluff including Descriptions, Lore, Ecology, Adventure Seeds and some ideas for memorable Loot.

+ Paper Mini designs for EVERY monster! Designed for easy print and play so you can easily get them on your table quick!

+ VTT tokens for EVERY monster if you prefer to play your oldskool on Roll20, etc.

boardgame.name: Pilgrimage: Start your journey
boardgame.description:
Go on a journey through Europe for the most beautiful pilgrimages.
Create your own route and be the first to visit the most beautiful places. Choose the right means of transport and outsmart your fellow players. Go on foot, by plane or with the boat. Collect as many holy objects as possible to earn some extra points. Choose the fastest route, and be the first player to collect 12 shells and win the game!

Pilgrimage is a 2 to 4 player game that takes about 45 minutes to play. Players make a pilgrimage in search of beautiful pilgrimage places. To prove that they have reached one, they collect route tokens. With these route tokens, players commemorate their pilgrimage. Use boats and planes to speed up your journey and collect artifacts to make your commemoration worth more points. Which of your family or friends makes the largest pilgrimage?

During the game, players use the cards in their hands to move around the board. Each turn you play one card that indicates how many steps you're allowed to move forward. When you reach one of the four destination that are shown in the top corner of the board, you may pick that tile an place it in front of you. Players instantly receive the shells shown on the tile. Keep in mind that the tiles should always fit in your collection by connecting the lines, if not, you cannot collect them. Players also have personal powers and ways to bother their opponents. The first player to collect 12 shells wins the game.

boardgame.name: Onyx Sky (Free Version)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Onyx Sky explores our world after a devastating global war and environmental collapse plunge humanity back into the stone age.

In Onyx Sky, players create characters who've been safe inside a military bunker, government facility, fallout shelter, or scientific vault. After decades hidden away, they emerge from their haven.

They find a world in ruin, its communities struggling to endure against roaming marauders, autonomous battle droids, and metal-eating nanites.

The players' characters, armed with contemporary knowledge and ideals, are thrust into a world in technological and cultural freefall.

Onyx Sky, from the ENnie award-winning designer of Hero Kids, Forge Engine, and Heroes Against Darkness, is:

All In One RPG: Everything you need to play a campaign; Player Content, Game Rules, GM Guidance, Campaign Guide, and Adversaries.
Relatable Future: Onyx Sky's post-apocalyptic setting is a possible future; grounded, plausible, and terrifying.
No Wasted Words: Tightly written and jam-packed with gameable content.


Onyx Sky includes:

Game Rules: The game rules cover character creation and development, attribute tests, skills, exploration, combat, downtime, and travel.
Player Content: Everything players need to create, develop, and run their characters; traits, general skills, martial skills, and equipment.
GM Support: Instruction for game mastering Onyx Sky campaigns.
Adversary Templates: Onyx Sky includes 28 adversary templates for Grunts, Strikers, Tanks, and Commanders.

boardgame.name: Onyx Sky
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Onyx Sky explores our world after a devastating global war and environmental collapse plunge humanity back into the stone age.

In Onyx Sky, players create characters who've been safe inside a military bunker, government facility, fallout shelter, or scientific vault. After decades hidden away, they emerge from their haven.

They find a world in ruin, its communities struggling to endure against roaming marauders, autonomous battle droids, and metal-eating nanites.

The players' characters, armed with contemporary knowledge and ideals, are thrust into a world in technological and cultural freefall.

Onyx Sky, from the ENnie award-winning designer of Hero Kids, Forge Engine, and Heroes Against Darkness, is:

All In One RPG: Everything you need to play a campaign; Player Content, Game Rules, GM Guidance, Campaign Guide, and Adversaries.
Relatable Future: Onyx Sky's post-apocalyptic setting is a possible future; grounded, plausible, and terrifying.
No Wasted Words: Tightly written and jam-packed with gameable content.


Onyx Sky includes:

Game Rules: The game rules cover character creation and development, attribute tests, skills, exploration, combat, downtime, and travel.
Player Content: Everything players need to create, develop, and run their characters; traits, general skills, martial skills, and equipment.
GM Support: Instruction for game mastering Onyx Sky campaigns.
Adversary Templates: Onyx Sky includes 28 adversary templates for Grunts, Strikers, Tanks, and Commanders.


This DELUXE FULL VERSION of Onyx Sky also contains 72 extra pages of Setting, Campaign, and Adversary content (144 extra pages in the upcoming print book).

Campaign Guide: The deluxe version of Onyx Sky includes an extensive campaign toolbox overflows with setting background, campaign design guidance, adventure seeds, unique encounters, hazards, locations, groups, and companions.
Adversaries: The deluxe version of Onyx Sky includes 78 illustrated human, animal, and droid adversaries.


Onyx Sky's Setting takes players into our near-future:

Our World: Thirty years from now, global war and environmental collapse have decimated the world's population.
In Decay: Microscopic nanites consume metal to replicate themselves, stripping the world of metal piece by piece.
Naive Newcomers: The players' characters emerge into this world after three decades sheltering safely in a fallout shelter, military facility, survival bunker, or research.
Relentless Droids: Military battle droids roam the land, seaching indescriminately for targets.
Depraved Adversaries: Communities of survivors struggle to survive in this degraded world, struggling against opportunistic raiders, brutal warlords, and mercilous autonomous battle droids.


Onyx Sky's Campaign Guide includes content and prompts to support game-masters running an Onyx Sky campaign:

Campaign Bible: The Campaign Bible introduces Onyx Sky's broken world, including its themes, tone, and denizens.
Character Origins: Varied examples of the government, scientific, medical, and civilian facilities where the player characters have sheltered.
Character Goals: Guidance for building an engaging Onyx Sky campaign by matching player preferences with an appropriate narrative style.
Campaign Elements: Hundreds of elements to fill out your world; unique encounters, hazards, locations, groups, and companions.
Adventure Seeds: Seeds to inspire you with grounded and open-ended adventures


Onyx Sky's Adversaries section includes 78 challenging and versatile animals, droids, and humans:

Animals: With the human population greatly reduced, animal predators are resurgent, including big cats, bears, snakes, wolves and dogs, hyena, and more.
Droids: During the great war, the military-industial complex perfected autonomous battle droids; simple workhorses, experimental hunter-killers, drones, and huge titan-class units.
Humans: In the devastated world, other survivors might be allies or enemies, with adversaries including bandits, ferals, cannibals, slavers, reavers, nutes, neonates, militia, and cultists.

boardgame.name: Onyx Sky Introductory Adventure: Salt City Dogs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This FREE INTRODUCTORY ADVENTURE for Onyx Sky includes:

Introductory Adventure: In Salt City Dogs, the players are a group of prisoners who are forced into an experimental military cryogenic hibernation program.
30 Years Later: The prisoners wake - disoriented - and find themselves in an abandoned military research facility; when they venture outside they find the world in ruin.
Learning Through Play: Salt City Dogs seamlessly teaches the players Onyx Sky's system and rules through play.
Mini-Setting Guide: The Salt City Dogs adventure also includes a mini-setting guide for the post-apocalyptic Salt Lake region, supporting GMs to transition the adventure into a full Onyx Sky campaign.
Packed With Content: This free adventure is 44 jam-packed pages, including easy-to-run scenes, compelling and flexible encounters, and location and region maps.

boardgame.name: The Earth Above
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Earth Above is a module for the sci-fi horror RPG, Mothership.

A terrifying alien species known as The Pest has invaded a remote mining facility taking thesector’s only ship fuel source offline.

The androids charged with protecting the miners have ceased communication with their parent corporation.

You’re out of fuel, and the only place to find it is deep within the mines, but that’s where the Pest are.

Welcome to Cormeia-9.

The Earth Above includes everything you need to run a short 1-3 session Mothership story.

6 unique NPCs with motivations and conflicting desires
5 new creatures stated for use in Mothership
Fully detailed mining facility
3d-modeled Mine map and detailed locations
d100 table
new weapons and items
Warden Tips

boardgame.name: Peaky Blinders: Shelby Company Trading
boardgame.description:
1920’s Birmingham, an era of gang warfare. But war never goes without business.

In this Peaky Blinders game, players become employees of the Shelby Company Limited. Run your part of the business in Birmingham, London and other surrounding areas. Gather your products and sell them on the market to the highest bidder. To master this strategic card game, players will need to be able to guess the amount of bids they will win. High value products will not win you the game. Bluff, think-forward and manage your stock to become The wealthiest gangster in the UK!

Peaky Blinders Shelby Company Trading is a small tactical board game with players receive 10 cards to play 10 rounds with. It's possible to win a round by placing the highest card on the table, but it's not about winning the most rounds. Players guess the amount of rounds they will win, and earn their victory by guessing the most correct rounds. Player lives and player cards make this game a tactical bluffing game for quick card game lovers.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Forgotten Sea
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Forgotten Sea is a Monster of the Week mystery.

Who hasn't wanted to be a monster hunter at one point in time? Shows like Buffy and Supernatural are at the core of the great PbtA game Monster of the Week. It's a fantastic game that is lets you dig deep into the genre. If you haven't checked it out you should do it right now.....we'll wait.

The Forgotten Sea is a mystery for whatever group of hunters you are itching to play. A mining company in a small midwestern town dug too deep and uncovered a ancient evil. Now an insidious cult spreads through town worshiping this creature. Can your hunters defeat the threat in time?

boardgame.name: Super Hero RPG!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A freeform Superhero RPG inspired by the Free Kriegspiel Revolution!

Super simple d6 based rules and plenty of tables and generators to fill your game with heroes, villains, places, organisations, goons, missions and more! Includes HTML files with fully automated versions of all of the tables in the PDF to make generating game details happen with the click of a button!

boardgame.name: Bloody Theater
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fledgling Vampires, Nighthounds, the Fatberg and more are all statted and ready to throw at your players!

We have also created a new weapon type, Kukri, and a cursed version, a Kukri of Bleeding, for your table to enjoy.

Lastly, we added some casino games to use at The Glittering Die or any other gambling establishment your players come across!

The Theater District was once a destination for the city’s citizens, but rising crime and strange disappearances have driven many patrons away. Theaters and taverns sit mostly empty and passerby on the streets avert their eyes, hurrying about their business. Worse, are the rumors of the things lurking in the darkness.

The vampire Thorne Astric has come for revenge. Long ago Vamilda Thrace and her adventuring group, Animus, hunted him down. Vamilda retired and started the Animus Playhouse in honor of the companions she lost. The district became a popular entertainment destination and prospered.

Now, Astric’s machinations threaten to destroy everything Vamilda holds dear.

Bloody Theater (5e) contains:

A District Map
2 Encounter Tables
Four Unique Factions: Vampires, the Watch, Kobold Street Sweepers, and the Shifting Hands gang.
17 unique NPCs
6 new creatures statted for 5e
A new weapon: the Kukri
Cursed item: Kukri of Bleeding

boardgame.name: Kontext Spiel d6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A two page d6 based freeform tabletop adventure game!

boardgame.name: Kidsweek Taalhelden van het spelwoud
Taalhelden van het spelwoud
boardgame.description:
The language heroes (Taalhelden) jump into action to defeat the monsters of the game forest with you. The game forest is full of dangerous creatures that feed on language and only the language heroes can defeat them. Choose your favorite language hero, create your own game forest and work together to defeat the monsters with your language skills!

The educational game can be played at different levels: level 1 from group 4 to level 3 for groups 7 and 8. The game can be played at school or at home and contains a booklet with no less than 60 texts to train your brain.

Players place cards on the table to form a path through the Game Forest. With personal language heroes, they walk the path to find treasure chests and defeat bosses. To defeat bosses, players answer questions related to texts they read. By answering a question correctly, the players earn stars, which are added together at the end of the game to form a high score.
Can you and your team get the best high score? Let the adventure begin!



Kidsweek Taalhelden van het spelwoud is a game about creating an adventure together and slaying monsters with your language skills. Each turn, players place cards to create a route towards boss monsters and treasures. They move on this created route with their heroes to reach treasures and to battle boss monsters. Battling monsters will cost players a live, so they need to collect those lives back by looking for treasures. By answering questions (fighting boss monsters) about the Dutch language, players score stars together. The game ends when the deck of cards runs out. Try to earn a lot of stars to increase your score and set you highscore.

boardgame.name: Generic Room Stocker
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A collection of tables, generators and tools for creating weird and wonderful rooms for tabletop adventure games.

boardgame.name: The d6 Demiurge
boardgame.description:
Protocols for TTRPG play without a Referee

Publisher's blurb:

The d6 Demiurge can be used to explore a fantasy world without a Referee. Alternatively, the tables and protocols can be used by a Referee as a guide for presenting a reactive and interesting fantasy world to their players.

The d6 Demiurge includes:


A Yes/No table for auguring a deeper understanding of your fantasy world.
Simple protocols for running a referee-less game.
Tables for ensuring the environment is ever-changing and filled with drama and conflict.
Tables for running active and interesting friends and foes.
Tables for interpreting the objective outcomes of the player character’s actions.

boardgame.name: Carnage
boardgame.description:
A semi-cooperative board game of terror and violent survival. Inspired by the greatest works of horror, Carnage is a game driven by your choices and your ability to survive against deadly traps, madmen and even your friends. For 2 to 6 players from 14 years old. Filled with Easter eggs from popular horror movies, old and recent, this is a must for the lovers of the genre. There are tons of references to slashers, psychopaths and other villains as well as iconic locations and items.

Each player gets 4 actions to spend during a turn.

To win:
1. Complete your personal objective
2. Start the power in the Engine Room
3. Unlock the door to the Control Room
4. Get out

Highlights
1. Simple gameplay for an instant immersive experience, while complex in its variables for a great replayability.
2. Play certain cards at ANY time, including when you are not the active player.
3. Get through twisted and deadly traps that will certainly test your nerves.
4. Embrace your madness and take advantage of it if you would lose your sanity.
5. If you die, you now play as a Deranged to hunt and kill the other players.

boardgame.name: Candy Crush DUEL: Pocket Edition
boardgame.description:
Candy Crush DUEL the pocket edition is the smaller and easier version of the usual Candy Crush DUEL. 2 players battle each other by rolling dice and selecting candy to place on a grid. By creating the correct combinations, players score points. When the grid is full or there are no candy's left to place, the player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Magic and Sh*t
Magic and Shit
boardgame.description:
An Illustrated Compendium of Weird Ass Magical Items

From the introduction:

In the late 80s - early 90s, my best friend and I were a couple of long-haired, young metalheads living in small town Arkansas. Our primary outlets were heavy metal and playing Dungeons and Dragons when and wherever we could. The evangelical south was not a fertile ground for either of those pursuits but we were not to be deterred.

We were disciples at the altar of legendary cover artists like Doug Johnson, Derek Riggs, Pushead, Joe Petagno, Vincent Locke and Ed Repka. Eddie (waving that tattered flag), Snaggletooth and Vic Rattlehead were our co-pilots. Our tape decks were full of Sabbath, Metallica, Maiden and Priest. We couldn’t get enough.

We had an ongoing joke about looting the evil wizard’s “magic and shit”... your basic sweep the dungeon, waste the monsters and take all their sweet magic crap kind of scenario. The joke even spilled over into other things and it’s been one of those nostalgic inside jokes that we’ve inadvertently kept going for 30+ years.

Now, all these years later we had a chance to actually make it and get it illustrated by some of our favorite artists. My best friend banged out this killer cover art that homages some of our favorite bands. This is exactly the sort of homegrown, DIY sort of thing I signed up for back when I first started Planet X Games and knowing that it’s going to be a thing played at other gaming tables is a pretty rad feeling.

My best friend summed up why we did this zine in the first place, and what it means to us with this text he sent me earlier:

“I think of how there will be two teenage best friend nerds who are gonna see this and it’ll be a thing for them. They’ll laugh and have inside jokes about it. And they’ll look back years later and say “Hey, you remember that one game we played that summer? That shit was fun.”

Horns up for lifelong friendship and making cool shit!

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Space Opera Ref
boardgame.description: From galactic empires or federations to strange other world adventure, some of the largest science fiction franchises with initials such as ST, SW, BSG, and SG tell epic action and adventures in interstellar and galactic space. It has tables to help generate new content and material based on this specific sceince fiction subgenre—space opera.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Martial Arts Ref
boardgame.description: From wuxia to anime to epic martial arts cinema to action-adventure video game fighting games, martial arts media brought punching, kicking, sword swinging, throwing, and overall action entertainment. Whether it's kung fu, karate, ninjas, or MMA this issue focuses on many different martial arts media.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Dark Fantasy Ref
boardgame.description: From vampire slayers to witch hunters to monster hunters, dark fantasy brings together fantasy and horror. It mixes monsters, magic, supernatural, horror, and dread in a dark or gloomy tone.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Hard Science Fiction Ref
boardgame.description: From near future science to first alien contact to strange virus outbreaks, hard science fiction tries to keep science fiction accurate, consistent, and logical. This issue looks at the more realistic science fiction media and such.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Steampunk Ref
boardgame.description: From airships to trains and clockworks steampunk subgenre of science fiction is one of the largest of the retrofuturism subgenres inspired by literary works from Jules Verne and H.G. Wells. Mix in a bit of Mary Shelley, Arthur Conan Doyle, L. Frank Baum, or Lewis Carroll here and there.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Mythology Ref
boardgame.description:
Most of the resources found are Western mythology sources: Greek, Roman, Egyptian, and Norse mythology primarily. Stories from the Odyssey, Iliad, Beowulf, and more have inspired this issue.

From Zeus to Ra to Odin, and even Jesus, mythology brings epic stories of gods and goddesses to literature and fiction.

This even has a tool to help generate random adventure story scene synopsis or new dialogue based on interpreted results.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Post-Apocalypse Ref
boardgame.description:
From nuclear holocaust, killer robots, prophetic end-times, and zombie apocalypse to pandemic near extinction, post-apocalyptic fiction has entertain and warn of the potential collapse, destruction, or decline of human civilization. For over 100 years, writers and film makers have been speculating the impending doom. Some beliefs teach about the end of days. This issue focuses on post-apocalyptic science fiction, horror, fantasy, and even a little religion.

This even has a tool suggested to help generate random adventure story scene synopsis or new dialogue based on interpreted results.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Sword and Sorcery Ref
boardgame.description: From barbarians, beast masters, albino fallen kings to those in search of a great swords, mighty battle axe, or mythical greatstaff, the flawed heroes of sword and sorcery are in search of excting and violent adventures—sometimes in exotic places—often involving romantic flings, strange magic, and the supernatural.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Western Ref
boardgame.description: From gunslingers & outlaws to lawmen & cowboys, Western fiction and media explores the freedom, frontier, and adventures of unexploited wilderness far from the urban cities. So holster your revolvers, grab a shotgun, and saddle up to ride off into the spirit of the Wild West.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Mecha Ref
boardgame.description: Giant robotic or machines controlled by people fight other mecha, giant monsters, and invaders. Fill your science fiction or even fantasy game with the iron, steel, or special alloy creations.

boardgame.name: EKONOS (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
Ekonos is an economic strategy game for 2 to 6 players with simple mechanics.
You will have to compete with the rest of the players to take control of different board game publishers.
Become the President of these companies to decide their expansion policy, trying to make them grow and expand as much as possible throughout Europe.
Buying and selling shares at the right time will be the key to take control of the market.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Modern Action & Thriller Ref
boardgame.description: From fugitives to crime bosses to maffia to fast drifting cars to vietnam vets to heist masterminds and special agent spies, action heroes, buddy cops, and investigation specialists bring chases, gunfights, gangs, and perilous escapes to gaming, writing, movies, shows, and video games one explosion at a time.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Comedy & Humor Ref
boardgame.description: From sitcoms to jokes & riddles to parodies & spoofs to satires, comedy lets us laugh at normally serious subjects. Laughter helps us to live better.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Pulp Ref
boardgame.description: From barbarians to lords of the jungle to noir detectives to raiding tomb archaeologists to action heroes on mars, pulp represents action-magazines and stories that began in first-half of the 1900s known for fast action, heroic virtues, and questionable romantic flings.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Time Travel Ref
boardgame.description: From returning to the future to time traveling doctors to those stuck doing quantum leaping to cyborgs that terminate in modern times, time travel spans science fiction, fantasy, romance, and even mystery genres. Whether by vehicle, device, magic, supernatural powers, hibernation, or dreams, time travel allows a character to jump to different time periods, genres, and mix-up role-playing material.

boardgame.name: Generica Floorplans Volume 16: Stables
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hinterland Mapview can help you minimize the amount of prep time for your next homebrew campaign!

GENERICA Floorplans are a combination of traditional 2D maps and 3D visual aids which can help you flesh out your campaign setting. Generic fantasy town locations (such as Taverns, Temples and Shops) are showcased with carefully designed floorplans and 3D rendered views to provide your players with a more immersive gaming experience.

Each GENERICA Floorplans volume contains one 3D Exterior Mapview, two isometric top-down Floorplan Maps, as well as additional 3D renders of Interior Mapviews. Each download also includes two full-sized gameplay maps designed to be printed at 16” x 20”.

boardgame.name: Geographica World Maps Vol. 2-E
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hinterland Mapview can help you minimize the amount of prep time for your next homebrew campaign!

Need a homebrew world map but lack significant drawing skills? Need a detailed continent map calling out specific biomes, but don’t have the time or money to spend on complex mapping software? Hinterland Mapview’s GEOGRAPHICA map series can jump start your creative process by providing you with a variety of generic full color geographical maps.

Each full color GEOGRAPHICA map delineates grasslands, desert sands, heavily forested areas, mountainous regions, landforms trapped beneath glacial ice, and depicts prominent rivers and lakes as well. Each map is essentially a blank slate for you to place cities and towns wherever you wish. Each color map is accompanied by a black & white version delineating only mountains and rivers, allowing you to sketch out your own national boundaries and clearly label prominent landmarks yourself.

boardgame.name: Gates
boardgame.description:
An unusual 2-player abstract strategy game. Start the game by placing pieces onto the board — yours or your opponent’s. Then, guide your pieces to the escape gates before your opponent does the same.


OBJECT OF THE GAME
Score all of your Spikes by getting them to your Gates.

MOVEMENT
Players now attempt to move their Spikes to their Gates while blocking their opponent. The last player to place in Placement gets to move first in Movement. On your turn in Movement, pick any one of your Spikes and move it one space in any direction.

Trapezoids can land on enemy spikes to move them to any empty space.
Triangles move two spaces instead of one.

SCORING
When you move one of your Spikes into one of your Gates, the Spike is scored, removing it from the game.
After scoring, your opponent may then relocate the Gate that you just used, placing it on any empty space.
Your Spikes can’t move onto your opponent’s pieces (except for Trapezoids, which can land on enemy Spikes).
Continue moving and scoring Spikes in turns.

Once a player has scored all four of their Spikes, they win!

boardgame.name: Dice Plunder
boardgame.description:
A jolly game of piracy for 2. Loot cargo from your opponent to upgrade your ships and rule the seas.

The seas are ripe for plunder! Pirates fight for control of cargo and territory, clashing in epic naval battles for supremacy. You and your ragtag fleet of ships encounter another captain on the seas. This means war! Upgrade all your ships from Sloops to the Man O’ War to seize the ocean!

Players move their ships by flipping coins, battling and plundering their way to earn coins. With these coins, they upgrade their ships.

To win, upgrade all of your ships to Man O’ War. Once all three of your ships are Man O’ War, you drive out your opponent’s fleet and conquer the seas!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Stellar Expedition
boardgame.description:
One of the many space gates left behind by the ancient aliens only known as the ‘Nameless’, recently activated. The smartest scientific minds in the galaxy have come to the conclusion that once you enter the gate, you only have a limited amount of time before it shuts down again.

You and your opponents are the chosen captains that take their spaceships through the mysterious gate and explore the riches that lay beyond. You can choose to represent the half Robot half insect Hive mind of Tognath, the cunning and ruthless Maheri tribes, the spacefaring tree hugging Sky-Lords of Edda or just be a plain old human of the United Nations Explorer Corps.

Each of you will take up missions to gain Expedition points and win the most prestige with your superiors back home. But you won’t be able to complete the missions on your own. Once through the gate, you will have to befriend the locals and assemble the best crew to overcome the dangers of this unexplored part of space.

Explore, recruit crew members, build embassies, acquire resources and go back through the gate before is closes again.

The game is played over 8 different rounds who ever brings home the most Expedition points at the end will win this space race!

boardgame.name: Future History
boardgame.description:
Tomorrow Awaits

In a spaceship hovering over the ruins of the primogenitor homeworld, you may wonder: How did we get here? The answers await – in GURPS Future History. A companion to GURPS Space and a parallel of GURPS Infinite Worlds, this supplement offers an invaluable toolkit for designing plausible speculative histories and playing in campaigns set in forthcoming eras.

Starting with discussions on high-level short- and long-term trends – including what's constant, what changes, and what cycles seem to define humanity – Future History uses those building blocks to help create new timelines. Craft your campaign with ideas for divergent societies, extreme events, forces that influence change, and more. Devise deft denizens to navigate these new nows, with 10 GURPS occupational templates and discussions of key character traits. Use the extensive advice to forge adventures that fit the setting's themes and ideas, giving the heroes a chance to shine like the stellar skies. Whether you're plotting new tomorrows or just trying to survive on strange new worlds, the future is what you make it.

- Publisher's description

boardgame.name: The Scout Class for OSR Role Playing Games
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Old School Games the role of reconnaissance is often filled by the thief. The problem is that while thieves are capable of reconnaissance, they are not trained for it. Their skill set is missing vital skills to be able to give the party good information on what lies ahead. To make matters worse the party must always guard their valuables when dealing with a thief. The solution is to get a person with a background as a military scout.

The Scout Class was created explicitly to fill the role of providing high quality reconnaissance to the party. In addition to this the characters military background means that they are more capable in combat then a thief of the same level. Finally, since they are not a thief the party does not have to worry about their valuables.

boardgame.name: Mechamancer: Cyborg Barbarian
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mechamancer blends machinery and flesh in an unholy union more powerful than sinew or gears alone. Alien technology, clockwork, or arcane apparatus might form the basis for these enhancements, but they always leave the mechamancer disconnected with their humanity. At best, a mechamancer might retain some spark of their former selves, but most eventually lose touch with reality and see only the processes and routines that guide them.

Mechamancers undergo augmentation for any number of reasons. Some find their human forms too frail, others yearn for immortality, and some are forced down the path by uncaring artificers as part of insane experiments that blend the natural and mechanical.

The mechamancer is an alternative to the barbarian class, and many of the additional options available to a barbarian can be rethemed to fit a mechamancer, with your GM’s approval. Specifically, surge and rage, and primary function and primal path, are synonymous. The mechamancer’s major difference from a standard barbarian is in how they use armor, and mechamancers gain several penalties and ability changes to balance their increase to Armor Class.

boardgame.name: The Koryo Hall of Adventures: Spell List (Pathfinder 1.0)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Spells List was developed for the Pathfinder 1.0 Koryo Hall of Adventures campaign setting. It offers a list of setting specific spells that enhance the gaming experience in the world of Jeosung.

boardgame.name: The Koryo Hall of Adventures: OSR Conversions Document
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this simple ebook, you will find conversions to all the mechanics used in the Koryo Hall of Adventures campaign setting book. From the Mudang, Jaein and Sunim classes, to the beasts, and a comprehensive set of tables to generate your own wild spirits, everything is there for you to bring the world of the original book into your OSR game. (This ebook includes only mechanics. If you want to get the full experience with lore, mythology, more races, NPCs, Jeosung’s Gazetteer, and a whole lot more, make sure to get the full Koryo Hall of Adventures in addition to this conversions document).

boardgame.name: Dokkaebi Playable Race
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this digital book, you will find the Dokkaebi playable race, including background information on the Dokkaebi, their origins and how they have come to build an evil society of sorts. You will learn about their beliefs and how to best insert a Dokkaebi into your game or campaign.

boardgame.name: Sunim: Monk Subclass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this digital book, you will find the Sunim Monk Subclass and two monastic traditions: Sunmudo and Taekwondo. You will learn about Purism, the religion followed by the monks of Jeosung, about the Followers and about Hwanggung, the individual at the origin of Purism. Through the use of these two monastic traditions, you will be the embodiment of the Tenets of Purism, and will learn to use your hands and feet with lethal speed and accuracy.

boardgame.name: Hapkido: Fighter Martial Archetype
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this digital book, you will find a fighter martial archetype based on the Hapkido martial art for the Koryo Hall of Adventures campaign setting book. The origins of hapkido are credited to the scholar and warrior Kwon Jungjo—a general in the army of the Dragon King of Yuinguk during the Second Age—who was meditating near the shrine of the primordial snake when he was attacked by a group of bandits. Hapkido trains a soldier to be able to fight in both armed and unarmed scenarios, and to disable armed opponents. Your hands become weapons unto themselves not unlike a Monk’s, though they are less for striking and more for neutralizing opponents.

boardgame.name: Taekkyeon: Rogue Archetype
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this digital book, you will find a rogue archetype based on the Taekkyeon martial art for the Koryo Hall of Adventures campaign setting book. The origins of taekkyeon are credited to Lady Wolmae, a kisaeng (courtesan) at the court in Dongyongguk during the violent reign of Dragon King Yeonsangun, late in the Second Age. Inspired by the movements and grace of birds, it allows its practitioners to use lethal techniques while making just as much sound as a feather falling on the ground.

boardgame.name: Centipede
boardgame.description:
Centipede, a story game for one player.

Third in Dandelion series.

boardgame.name: Seafaring Supplement: Cargo and Goods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Diversify that treasure hoard! If your PCs have been busy pillaging ships and you've been scrambling to compile their goods, this is the answer!

The Seafaring Supplement Cargo and Goods contains five pages of goods, three tables, and instructions on how to easily create the cargo manifest of your next ship.

boardgame.name: Seafaring Supplement II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take your adventures on the open ocean!

The Seafaring Supplement II contains 3 samples ships to challenge your PCs. There are also more crew and creature statblocks, with challenges range from ½ to 13. Make every ship encounter unique with new captains and crew members.

This file is also packed with over two pages of new magical items perfect for seafaring PCs, and four pre-made treasure hoards.

boardgame.name: What Are The Rules Again?
boardgame.description: A card game where players start with a core set of rules and come up with the rest of the rules themselves as they play. The game breaks rules into categories, requires one player to act as GM, and provides rule guidelines for new players.

boardgame.name: Dastardly
boardgame.description: Players play "tactic" cards in order to complete tasks. Tasks grant rewards when completed and are assigned faster as the game progresses. If too many tasks build up, a player is eliminated. Players may chain copies of the card(s) a player plays on their turn. Game encourages players to copy, counter, and steal each others' cards and tasks.

boardgame.name: Iceberg Dead Ahead
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A season 10 tier 2 adventure APL 8.

Seed: The littles Squidling

This title is a seafaring adventure where you are tasked by the Zhentarim disguising as the Merchants guild to retrieve a missing cargo. The players have to travel out to the sea of Ice on search of the missing ship, roumored to be stuck onto an iceberg.Other interested parties are also looking for this cargo, who will find it first, and what is it?

This adventure contains many ship and sailing puns, references to Titanic, humor, two sets of four different routes(part 1 and part 2), and the adventure will test even a seasoned player.

Get ready to set out to sea and discover the secrets in the icy waters!
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Ship-Board Campaigns
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A campaign set at sea is rather different to a land-based one. A ship is not just a set of horses made of wood to carry the PCs from one scenario to another. For a start, a ship comes with a crew, with whom the PCs will have to interact. A ship-board campaign has a very cinematic feel.

boardgame.name: Zombicide: The Broken Token Zombicide Medieval Fantasy Hoard Chest
boardgame.description: Want to keep things simple? If you went all in on the Kickstarter you can store everything in this premium, thematically engraved crate. Accommodates 10-player capacity for Black Plague and Green Horde, as well as all the Kickstarter exclusives and optional buys. Some repeated components will need to be stored separately

Massive Darkness: Black Plague Crossover Set
Massive Darkness: Zombicide Green Horde Crossover Set

boardgame.name: ARC: Doom Tabletop RPG
boardgame.description:
ARC powers lean and tightly-paced stories. The unique blend of real-time and in-story mechanics means that games feel urgent and high-stakes.

During the game, you overcome challenges by rolling a six-sided die after setting a Threshold Number determined by your hero's capabilities, problem-solving approach, and the difficulty of the task. Roll under means success, over fails, and an equal roll generates even more complications.

The rest of ARC's system is overclocked to spark stories that slay.

- Actions come with consequences. ARC explicitly guides players to roll only when there's real stakes involved. In many situations, it's entirely possible to fail intentionally to reap opportunities, or accept success with tangible consequences.

- Celebrate ingenuity. Heroes are naturally adept at their skills, but players articulate how these are applied: whether creatively, carefully, or in a concerted manner. Insightful solutions can ease the Threshold Number.

- A new approach to spellcasting. Cast spells & techniques with different power levels, but take care: replenishing these will require a strange ritual. Burning a memento, sleeping all day, even eating a door.

...and spark groups that just want to play.

- Any fantasy story, any setting. ARC is not tied to a setting and can be adapted to your favorite world—even your own unique creation.

- Manage your hours. The Doomsday Clock allows you to dictate literally how much time you need for your story.

- Scaffolding to sustain dynamics and agency. Session zero prompts to set collective expectations; clear focus on cultivating shared stakes; and structure + guidance to ensure story arcs breathe, live, and respond meaningfully to player action.

Beyond rules, ARC is written to enable anyone—newcomer and veteran alike—to build world-saving stories together. The end may be coming, but that doesn't mean you can't be a new adventurer.

Doom is the centerpiece and the enemy—and running out of time unleashes it on the world. But while it's a turn for the worse, it is not a fail state. Instead, it can even provide the foundation for the next exciting chapter...

Add in bonus content in the form of 50+ items, 40 spells & techniques and 36 unusual creatures, from bunny-eared noblins to moon-eating wyrms, and you have plenty of (optional) flavor for stories as vivid and strange as ARC's art.

boardgame.name: Dino Force
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Con Dino Force puedes jugar en un mundo en el que la creación de dinosaurios fue un éxito e incluso se normalizó. Una agencia se creó para regularizar las actividades con los dinosaurios: Dino Force. En este juego formarás parte de un equipo gubernamental donde cada uno de tus compañeros tendrá un aliado muy poderoso, un dinosaurio fabricado ex profeso para cada uno que aprenderá y mejorará a medida que tu lo haces.

Juego inspirado en la genial escena de Jurassic World donde Cris Evans va de cacería con sus raptores montado en su moto.

Este juego es una ambientación para FATE.

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Frost Kings
boardgame.description:
An adventure for a 5th level party of 5 to 6 characters

From the introduction:

Tomb of the Frost Kings was the runner up in the 2009 KODT Adventure Contest. We were pleased with the entries and it was a tough choice narrowing them down to the finalists. Tomb of the Frost Kings is a dark adventure where, on the course of a rescue mission, the party stumbles upon a den of unholy, evil creatures. This adventure is a race against time to rescue the innocent from their vile clutches, and it is not for the faint of heart. Some might die, but for those who survive, the rewards will be great.

User summary:

Portions of this scenario originally appeared in Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 92 - Jun 2004) and Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 93 - Jul 2004); the scenario then appeared in Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 149 - Mar 2009) and later was made available as a separate PDF download.

boardgame.name: Terror in Paradise
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Terror in Paradise is an adventure for 3-6 sea-faring characters of around 3rd to 4th level.
...
The scenario begins with the player characters aboard a ship, exploring uncharted waters. They come to an idyllic island, and anchor in the bay close to a human village. The natives seem extremely friendly and welcoming.

boardgame.name: Thormek's Mansion
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

An old, powerful sorcerer, Thormek, was trying to breed a race of warriors to help him conquer the world. Eventually, one of the creatures he bred killed him, but not before he had summoned and imprisoned a demon to serve him.

boardgame.name: Those First Steps
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A group of young adventurers shares their first quest after stopping a group of bandits, a quest that will lead them into the very heart of the domain of the greatest Archmage in history.
...
[T]his module is intended to introduce new players to the setting by serving as a “lead‐in” of sorts to CZA1: Castle Zagyg: Dark Chateau.
...
For those wishing to use this module with Castles & Crusades, please see the Appendix.

boardgame.name: The Compleat Chainmail Combat System
boardgame.description:
Using Chainmail to resolve OD&D Combats

Publisher's blurb:

[The Compleat Chainmail Combat System is] an expanded look at using Chainmail with OD&D...Combines my system with several others, and forms a complete combat system for OD&D.

boardgame.name: Star Wars
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Several people have attempted efforts to create Star Wars RPGs using an old school feel. Many have been inspired by D&D, but none exist within the specific paradigm of the original D&D rules as written. All, so far, have made extensive modifications, from highly detailed combat and weapons rules to ascending AC and even changing the listed ability scores.

These rules are designed to function with minimal changes to the existing D&D paradigm and should be playable by anyone who has access to the original 3 booklets, plus supplements I, II, and III.

boardgame.name: The Age of Conan: Secrets of the Black Circle
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Well, folks, here we are! This one has been a long time coming. The last Age of Conan sourcebook was originally released all the way back in 2009. Since then, my ongoing campaign set in the world has gone through many shifts, evolutions and iterations, and it was time to put those into print for folks who want to see where things are going. I've also been promising a bestiary for quite some time, and this work includes a wealth of new monsters for your D&D Conan games.

In here you'll also find new combat rules, including a change to the Chainmail combat system that eliminates the need to check tables for each attack, rules for using the miniatures and battle boards from the Monolith Conan boardgame with your RPG games, new rules for sorcery and summoning (partially adapted from the Mongoose Conan game), and more. I think this provides just as much utility across the board as my last two did, and I hope you enjoy it.

boardgame.name: Houdini-Opoly
boardgame.description:
Houdini-Opoly is an exciting hero board game for 2-6 players built around the life of one of the most exciting personalities in history.

As you go around the board you will learn about the life of this great icon of the entertainment field, in a fun way. The real estate properties on the board are the actual key places in Houdini's life in chronological order. Each of the property deed cards has additional fun historic information about that particular time and place in Houdini's life. Each time you play you will get different deeds and land on different spots so both the both the enjoyment, and your knowledge about Houdini will increase.

Uses typical Monopoly rules and movement and has 14 tokens.

boardgame.name: Blood of Heroes
boardgame.description: Join brutal PvP battles in a new team action multiplayer.

boardgame.name: CONSCRIPT
boardgame.description: set in 1916 during the Great War.

boardgame.name: Шерлок Холмс (Sherlock Holmes)
ライナー・クニツィアのシャーロック・ホームズ ベイカー街221B
boardgame.description:
In Sherlock Holmes, detectives venture to the darkest parts of London trying to solve one of six different Sherlock Holmes cases.

At the start of the game, each player is given one of the six cases to solve (kept secret). On their turn, players move their detective piece one or two spaces on the board. Travelling from location to location, they collect clues to be the first to solve their case. Once all their clues have been collected, the player must arrest the criminal before the case is finally solved. Once a player has solved a case, every other player has ten turns to solve their case (losing 1 point each turn). The game ends once all players have solved their case (or if the last players have reached -10 points). All players who have solved their case count up their points (from their case tiles and if they successfully found the criminal) and the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Clue: Liars Edition
Cluedo: Für gute Schummler
Cluedo: Liars
Cluedo: Verze Lháři
Cluedo: Verzia Klamári
boardgame.description:
Sometimes you have to lie to get to the truth in the Clue Liars Edition board game in which players use Investigation cards (there are 6 Lie cards and 6 Truth cards) to help them figure out who killed Mr. Boddy in the mansion. Players pick a card and read it out loud, trying to play it cool and convince other players that they're telling the truth …even if they're not. If a player suspects they're lying they can call that player out by hitting the Liar Button. Were they caught lying or were they telling the truth? Either way, an Evidence card is revealed and players move one step closer to cracking the case. When a player is ready to make an accusation, they secretly look at the cards placed inside the case file envelope to reveal Who, What, and Where. A correct accusation wins the game!

LIE YOUR WAY TO THE TRUTH: Sometimes honesty is not the best policy…at least in this edition of the Clue game. Players sharpen their skills of deception with Investigation cards
THE LIAR BUTTON: Pick an Investigation card and read the action out loud. Whether it's a Truth card or a Lie card…try to be convincing. If another player thinks you're lying they can hit the Liar Button
WHO, WHAT, WHERE: In this twist on the classic mystery board game, players try to solve the murder of Mr. Boddy. Discover whodunit, with what weapon, and in which room
FUN FAMILY GAME: Remember playing the classic Clue game when you were a kid? Take out the Clue Liars Edition game for family game night, play dates, and rainy day entertainment.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

boardgame.name: A Cohort of Magpies
boardgame.description:
From the description:

We’ll go on without them. In libraries, rented-out cathedrals, auditoriums, living rooms. Sometimes together, sometimes apart, we will push on, always working. Our research is a flame that we must protect at all costs. No matter the stakes. It’s up to us now.

A Cohort of Magpies is a backdrop for the game Dialect. In it, you play as students and professors, eccentrics and prodigies, fighting to defend your academic field—something strange and beautiful that only you and your colleagues know intimately.

This is not a standalone game. To play it, you will need a copy of Dialect, written by Kathryn Hymes and Hakan Seyalıoğlu.

boardgame.name: Mindbug
boardgame.description:
In Mindbug, you summon hybrid creatures and send them to battle against your opponent — but when you summon a creature, the opponent may use one of their Mindbugs to take control of it. Outwit your opponent in a fascinating tactical duel in which having the best cards and playing them at the wrong time can be deadly for yourself.

Cards in Mindbug represent weird creatures that all come with unique and powerful abilities such as a Compost Dragon, a Snail Hydra, or a Kangasaurus Rex. Each player starts the game with ten creature cards (five in hand and five in a draw pile) and tries to use them to reduce the opponent's life total to zero. In addition, every player receives two Mindbug cards that can be used to mind control an opposing creature when it is played. This innovative Mindbug mechanism is the core of the game and leads to a unique decision-making process that makes Mindbug feel utterly different from any other card game.

Playing a card doesn't require any resources in Mindbug. As a result, the game has no ramp-up phase (such as gathering resources) and doesn't require weak cards. Since there is also no deck-building, you can start playing right away from a single deck. There is also no unfair advantage as players draw cards from the same deck and always get the chance to mind control the strongest opposing cards. In the end, it all comes down to your own decisions, making the game extremely fair and competitive at the same time.

—description from the publisher
